result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon H Steffen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Release only for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center.  Credit for one day 1/13/2015.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

04-07-2017/ Judge Carolina Stark
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to clarify that the original Probation term is two years and that the court extended probation on March 6, 2017 by one year for a total probation term of three years. 
**********


*March 6, 2017-Probation extended by one year.  Total period of probation is three (3) years.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remainng balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Seek/maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.178, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.  Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with Robbie K.
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court grants the defense request to expungment upon successfully completion of probation.

Notify DOC agent of all prescription  within three (3) business days of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill al prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent, and notify the DOC agent of the pharmacy used.
Participate in a Cognitive Behavior Program or Cognitive Intervention program.
Must be at home during the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. unless with verified work hours for the first year of probation, thereafter the curfew at the discretion of the agent.
Fine set at zero.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Must attend at least two alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least one (1) time per month for the first year of probation.

timeConds.notes:
125 days.  WITHOUT Good time credit.  Release only for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.  This is STAYED to be used as follows:  If any positive drug or alcohol use.
*MARCH 6, 2017  Serve total of six months.  Without good time credit.  Release only for the Day Reporting  Center.  Court has strong objection to electronic monitoring.  If defendant is not already in custody, a Commitment Order shall be issued immediately directing the Milw. Cnty Sheriff to take defendant into custody.

Ordered that JOC be amended to reflect this decision."

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sandra P. 
AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 11 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 1 day (01-13-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Defendant must attend at least 2 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per month 
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days  of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Robbie K. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Defendant must be at home during the hours of 9:00 pm and 6:00 am unless with verified work hours for the first year of probation, there after the curfew continued at the discretion of the agent. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 125 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center  and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring  This is stayed to use as follows: 
*If any positive drug or alcohol test.  
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTS the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Sheldon H Steffen in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sheldon H Steffen in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 
 
Case proceeded to sentencing.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on July 24, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties notified. Plea and sentencing hearing rescheduled from 06-25-2015 at 8:30 am to 07-24-2015 at 8:30 am, due to a clerical error in scheduling.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report dated June 8, 2015 received and filed.

All conditions remain the same as previously set: Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court addressed violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court amends cash bail.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Sheldon H Steffen not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing, Br 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Sheldon H Steffen not in court, in custody, not produced.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court orders case set for adjourned plea and ssentencing,, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 11, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Sheldon H Steffen in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/21/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sheldon H Steffen in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sheldon H Steffen in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
